content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    pattern = r"(?s)\```julia[\s\S]*?\```\n?"  # Pattern for Julia code blocks
    code_blocks = matchall(pattern, md)  # Extract all matches
    clean_code = map(s -> replace(s, pattern => ""), code_blocks)  # Remove code fences
    joined_code = join(clean_code, "\n")  # Join the code blocks with newlines
    return joined_code
end
```
This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown string `md` as input and returns a String containing all Julia code blocks in the document, with code fences removed and code blocks joined with newlines.
